TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AuthenticationMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the authentication mode to use in a Web application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationSection.Mode%2A> property to programmatically configure the type of authentication used by a Web application,
## Examples The following code example shows how to access the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationSection.Mode%2A> property.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationSection#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.configurati_43_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationSection#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.configurati_43_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationMode Forms = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Specifies ASP.NET Forms-based authentication as the authentication mode.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationMode None = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationMode Passport = int32(2)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This field is obsolete. The Passport authentication product is no longer supported and has been superseded by Live ID.")

Docs.summary: Specifies Microsoft Passport as the authentication mode.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationMode Windows = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Specifies Windows as the authentication mode. This mode applies when using the Internet Information Services (IIS) authentication methods Basic, Digest, Integrated Windows (NTLM/Kerberos), or certificates.
